intro: Oenone uleana, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Oenone uleana is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a rare species in some regions.
